instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Random issues, BIOS prob f**ked with
threads.message: Got a computer that came in that does random stuff. It won't display or boot rn or chime for that matter but the fans do spin. Customer said it would work off charger for a while and then just randomly go dark again. Inspected board and looks like a flux substances was caked near BIOS chip. Is there any solution to this or is this trash?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Random issues, BIOS prob f**ked with
threads.message: Start with cleaning it up and getting the exact history of the machine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Random issues, BIOS prob f**ked with
threads.message: Ok machine was sold to the store as a refurb. Original owner said refurbished from liquid damage and had new SSD installed. Sold to us fully functional sold to customer then returned to the store with issues turning on. I looked through the board and found absolutely zero liquid. Asked original seller since he's our local electronics recycler and he said he didn't know about BIOS but I think he's lying.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Random issues, BIOS prob f**ked with
threads.message: Inspect traces to <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and try a known good chip for testing. Read original chip and compare serial/board numbers to see if it is original.
